etymologies: early 20th century. From dict- + -o- + -graph, after phonograph. Perhaps compare Dictaphone

definitions: A form of telephone by means of which speech can be picked up by a sensitive microphone and reproduced by a loudspeaker in another location in the same building.

notes.text: The dictograph was designed to be used for remote dictation to a typist but was also used for eavesdropping.
